title: Places I've been
name: Places I've been
description:
A Map by Citycyclist

World travel sites

properties.name: A week in near paradise
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist With my parents, sister and daughter, I spent a week here in a house overlooking the bay. The mosquitoes were a menace, but otherwise it was perfection.

properties.name: A year in England
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist North Harrow, England1990s. Lived in this suburb northwest of London for a year, with my 6-year-old daughter. Spent most of our time traveling around England, Wales and Scotland. It\'s possible to drive from London to the Scottish Highlands in one day.

properties.name: Chatham, Cape Cod
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist Weekend here with friends. Packed with cars, but still lovely, especially when away from the crowds of tourists.

properties.name: Childhood in Tulsa, Part I
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist Lived here just a few years, after moving from Pryor. Very few memories--more of the neighborhood than of the house itself. Attended Hoover Elementary School through 3rd grade.

properties.name: Childhood in Tulsa, Part II
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist Tulsa, OklahomaActually, this was the 4th or 5th house I lived in, but from 1961 to 1975, it was my home. Went to Phillips Elementary School, and then Edison Jr/Sr High School.

properties.name: College years
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist Four excellent years (not counting a term in London).

properties.name: Colorado Springs
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist NYC to Co Springs to Tulsa to NYC. Round trip nearly 4000 miles, and I drove the whole thing, solo, in 6 days (not counting a one-day rest in Tulsa). My daughter is now in college in Co Springs. She loves it there.

properties.name: Farthest North (pre 2008)
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist Narvik, NorwaySite of WWII battle. Arrived by boat, from Bodo. But now no longer my farthest north. See North Cape 2008.

properties.name: Farthest South
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist Invercargill New Zealand1988. Jumping off point to Stewart Island, starting point for my cycling tour of the southern end of the South Island. Set off from here to Te Anau and points north.

properties.name: Favorite spot in all the world, possibly
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist Grinton, EnglandTiny village, in Swaledale. Cycled through here a few times, stayed in youth hostel here, brought my mother, my daughter and my niece here. Would live here if I could.

properties.name: First hospital stay
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist 1045 E. 100 s Salt lake city utah 84102This was formerly known as Holy Cross Hospital. I was born here in the early 1950s. Within 3 years my family had moved to Pryor, Oklahoma.

properties.name: Four corners, Part II
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist san diego, californiaVisited family, attended a conference here

properties.name: Four corners, Part III
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist Jacksonville Beach, floridaAttended a conference here, with friends; drove to old town of St. Augustine.

properties.name: Four corners, Part IV
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist I-95, MaineRoad trip with my daughter and her friend, en route to Canada

properties.name: Four corners, part I
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist seattle, washingtonVisited friends and family here.

properties.name: Liana bridge
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist Crossed a vine bridge while hiking to famous falls at Poubara

properties.name: My 21st birthday
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist Thessaloniki, GreeceTraveling through Europe in the early 1970s, passed through here on my way to Delphi, Athens, and Crete. Spent my birthday drinking ouzo in a taverna. Did not get drunk, just happy.

properties.name: My first century
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist Montauk, New York100+ miles from NYC to the lighthouse at Montauk Point State Park. Cycled this in one day (when I was much younger). Started out at 5 am, finished before dark.

properties.name: My neighborhood for 20 years
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist New York, New York 10033Great mix of many cultures--Dominican, Greek, Orthodox Jew, Russian. North of the GWBridge and yet not too far from the rest of Manhattan. A great place to raise a kid.

properties.name: North Cape--Farthest North 2008
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist

properties.name: Peace Corps Posting
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist Booue, Gabon1970s. Taught English in Booue, a village near the Ogooue River. A plane came twice a week; road traffic was intermittent (especially during the rainy season). And yet, not really lonely. Thank heavens for BBC World Service and an excellent radio.

properties.name: Pilgrim's Path
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist Croagh Patrick, IrelandHiked to shrine at top.

properties.name: Sedona, Arizona
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist Sedona, ArizonaFamily reunion, in and around fantastic red rock formations and several vortices. Wildfires to the north of us, in Oak Creek Canyon, thunderstorms passing through each day (it\'s also "monsoon season"), hot, Hot, HOT, and way too much good food. In other words, a perfect week away from NYC.

properties.name: Tenting Tonight
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist Badlands Natl Park, South DakotaBadlands National Park--great camp ground, if you don\'t mind close neighbors. Hot as blazes during the day, but lovely at night. Spent the night watching an electrical storm with my daughter.

properties.name: Vienna
properties.description: Posted by Citycyclist Taught a two-week course here in 2002, and again in 2009.
